result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Richard K. Love, appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2  ssigned.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney. DE motion to modify bond;arguments heard; Court modifies bond to $1000 cash with the same conditions. (see bond event).  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED. NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: KPD Officer Nicholas Benvenuto. Officer Tetrick. or Officer Curi except for professional purposes.
DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned. (sent to br.3)
to Modify Bond - filed by Atty. Joseph Corcoran  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (via Zoom) along w/Atty Jos. Corcoran.  Report has been received which opines the deft is competent to proceed.  State concurs with the findings.  Deft and defense counsel concur with the findings.  Court finds the deft is competent to proceed.  Case remanded back to Intake Court for preliminary hrg.  Deft waives the time limits.  PH set for 3/1/22 @ 9am.
